Tab 1

Welcome! This document demonstrates how Inkling can turn a Google Doc into a newsletter site and/or email.

  • Each H1 heading (#) marks a new edition/post.
  • Inside each edition, use H2 headings (##) for sections.
  • A footer will appear in all newsletters, if placed under a H2 heading called footer at the top of the document. Any text before this header is ignored, like this explanatory content.

Intro

This is the next edition of my amazing newsletter. I use Inkling to send out my newsletter using Google Docs and GMail. It also has an online/web edition.

Footer

This is the footer section. Inkling will automatically include it at the end of every edition:

  • ✉️ Contact: hello@example.com
  • 🌐 Website: https://inkling-demo.netlify.app/

You can use this QR to pay!

✨ Curiosities of the World

🌌 Science Spotlight

Octopus Cities

Octopuses are normally solitary, but in Jervis Bay, Australia, marine biologists discovered a place nicknamed Octopolis. Dozens of gloomy octopuses live in dens made of shells, bicker with neighbors, and occasionally share space like an undersea city.

👉 Read more

🎶 Sound of the Week

The World’s Oldest Known Song

On clay tablets from 3,400 years ago, archaeologists found musical notation — the Hymn of Ugarit. Reconstructed, it’s haunting and beautiful.

🎧 Listen here

🍄 Strange Nature

Zombie-Ant Fungus

A parasitic fungus takes over an ant’s nervous system, forces it to climb a plant, and then sprouts from its head. It sounds like science fiction, but it’s very real. 

🌟 Odd Histories & Lists

📚 History Corner

The Floating Library of Venice

In the 1300s, monks built their libraries on floating rafts. If the canals flooded, the books floated to safety. Practical, if a little soggy.

🧪 Curious Lists

Three random facts to surprise a friend:

  1. Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren’t.
  2. Wombat poop is cube-shaped.
  3. The Eiffel Tower grows ~15 cm taller in the summer.

🎨 Story Corner

The Artist and the Astronaut

When Apollo 11 landed on the moon, artist Yayoi Kusama covered her studio in polka dots and declared:

“If the earth disappears, I will fly to the moon.”

In 2021, one of her works finally did: it flew aboard a SpaceX rocket.

📝 Short & Sweet

✍️ Quote of the Week

“Not all those who wander are lost.” — J.R.R. Tolkien

(This edition shows how you can also publish short, lightweight posts.)
